meanings.definition: To number the pages of a book or document.
meanings.sent1: I am paginating the pages of my scrapbook to keep them in order.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is paginating the new books before shelving them.
meanings.sent3: I tried paginating my shopping list, but it just ended up confusing me.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a paginating machine, organizing thoughts into neat pages.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's method of paginating assignments made it easy for students to follow along.

meanings.definition: To divide a document into pages.
meanings.sent1: The software is paginating the long report for easier reading.
meanings.sent2: She spent hours paginating the manuscript before sending it to the publisher.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally started paginating my email, and now it looks like a book!
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to be paginating the landscape as it meandered through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The paginating process helped the writer see the structure of the document more clearly.
